The right sidebar I need to play the game with the characters did not appear on the first installation. Needed to reinstall and the game then played perfectly. The characters are a bit small for the phone. Also, I couldn't take my character into BG2.
replyContent:
Go into Settings > General > Accessibility > Zoom

A three-finger tap will bring up the zoom window.

A three-finger drag will scroll it down to the bottom of the screen which will allow you to restore the sidebar.

content: A bit laggy and controls could be better that being said it ports to pc which is very nice since windows 7 and up cant run original builders gate with inducing seizures. And I love that the game hasn't changed much so still a great game and worth getting

Almost as magical as playing it for the first time on the ol' family computer in '99. On a 6.4" screen w 4GB onboard memory I had only a few minor issues. Zooming in and out is a bit clunky on a smartphone, selecting tiny hidden treasures can be frustrating without a stylus, and the background highlight feature on the region map kills my frame rate. Other than that, it's one of the absolute best ports to Android of any roleplaying game out there.

content: I've played this and the sequel on mobile for nearly 5 years, with countless run-throughs. FANTASTIC. I'm about to start again!

BG has a standard of quality that BeamDog can't quite reach, and I'm not talking bugs. Don't buy the in-app purchase NPCs at least at first, as they're not written or constructed quite as well as the rest. Dragonspear more or less has the same issues. Still, it's the only way to have BG portable and the porting is well done outside of the port over to the BG2 engine. That's worth something.

Big map to explore, every quest is rewarding and interesting with a great back story! And not just rewarding in the "heres XP and gold" way, there are different rewards like reputation, weapons, spells, companions, discovering new locations, and more! Full in depth character customization that can change how you play and companions and weapons you can use, so the game also has great replay value. Everything from characters to the smallest side quests are in depth, interesting, and rewarding! BUY

It is an awesome game! It hits the DND feel right on the dot, and it's baldurs gate just more accessible! I have experienced a few bugs, but they either have been patched or are well known ones with a workaround (such as killing the necromancer when he's not casting a spell). I have a small phone, so it's a bit harder to control, but I knew what I was getting into and it's still possible! It's harder to navigate on a small phone, but I'm fine with it. Amazing game overall, I'd recommend it!

content: A great port of the PC game! The game runs really well on an old tablet (2016; low end then). The graphics, sound, etc. are all look great, and the touch controls are responsive (although it can hurt your fingers in particularly tough fights with all the tapping on screen). There are new graphical scenes throughout the game, which are nice--they don't quite match the graphic style of the rest of the game, but look like the art style you'd see in the D&D books today; I didn't mind. If you'd like another crack at BG today, especially while on the bus, etc., this is the way to go!

content: Unbelievable game, a real original take on exploration. Complicated a many head scratching moments, a game that is much needed in the disgusting world of terrible android games.

A great port aside from the controls. You can use a mouse and keyboard, but it's not what you want to do on a tablet. I own all of the Baldur's Gate franchise on PC and was keen to see how the Enchanced Edition played.  Overall, it's good, but is let down by the aforementioned controls. Mainly trying to interact with the environment, like opening small containers and looting bodies, or choosing and NPC to talk to, but the overarching annoyance is trying to move through doors, or to the next area on the map. I've died more times to not being able to get where I'm tapping, than in actually in combat.   You'll tap to open a door, then tap again to enter, except your whole party will just huddle in the doorway as you've not tapped the exact pixel that you are required to, even at full zoom. In combat this is disastrous, especially as you can accidentally select a single party member.  The same happens at the edge of maps, too.   Lastly, some menus don't have 'back' buttons on the screen, you need to summon your Android buttons if you don't have softkeys on your device.   A good port, but needs some polish. If they fixed it, I'd buy them all again for my tablet!
replyContent: Hello! Please log each of these issues into our bug tracker - support.baldursgate.com. Thanks!

content: The last update ruined everything! Graphics are awful, text is unreadable and blurry, characters selection's circles are ugly and bold... replyContent:
Hello! We’re aware about a fuzzy picture on certain Android devices. This was a fix for those devices that previously couldn’t handle the games’ performance on certain resolutions. We’re looking at ways we can fix the issue.
You can switch off or change graphical settings in Options.

Edit: Please report these issues at support.baldursgate.com

content: Would love to update but because of the way this game is saved and due to storage restrictions, the only way I can update is by doing a factory reset on my phone. I don't see why these games cannot be saved to as cards. I've put off playing bard because I would love to use the bard hat item in Siege of Dragonspear, also put off finishing the saga because I would love to do a full trilogy run. However I can't find any way to pull this off currently because I cannot transfer data to my sd card. And when uninstalled it leaves ghost files on my phone forcing me to factory reset and losing my saved games anyhow. BUT i am excited for the update so most likely will resort to reset anyhow, thanks for update Beamdog! EDIT: Just as an aside, I did reset my phone, these games are just that good. There is so much replay value in them, and so much passion put in to them. Beamdog has done an excellent job enhancing and porting these titles, if you're on the fence id suggest making the purchase, and don't worry about making the perfect character. Play it once through just exploring and enjoying it, you'll be doing yourself a great service. Any character can beat the game and new update adds story mode. There is a lot of information and you can overwhelm yourself before you even get to creating a character. Edit: Turn nearest neighbor scaling on to raise sharpness back if it doesn't suit you, I like it on with the sprite outlines enabled. I haven't encountered any bugs after I reset my phone so maybe the bugs have to do with new files not integrating well. Playing on a J7 Perx.

I've been playing this on a Chromebook for some time and was disappointed to see that the latest update broke keyboard shortcuts, and it's not being treated as a priority because non-screen keyboards aren't officially supported. If you're on a phone BG1 is the ONLY one worth buying anymore. The latest 
update for BG2 made the maximum zoom twice as far away so everything looks 
tiny on a small screen and is virtually unplayable. They haven't butchered

while it lasts. Moreover, this is probably the ONLY phone friendly game

content:
Amazing game from the past. It does have it's problems. This is on two 
different 1,3GHz quad core tablets running Android v4.4.2, v5.2 anzd v7.0 
systems: 1. Installing requires around triple the final size free space in 
the INTERNAL memory, and there is NO warning anywhere about this. Having an 
external card obviously doesn't help at all. I hope they will change that 
for the next version which they have the beta running (2.5), or at least 
hire someone who can make a proper installer. 2. Install fails in 2-4 tries 
out of 5. I have installed these games back and forth over 20 times,total 
when checking out the betas, and am glad I have no data limits. These 4 
infinity engine games are also the only games from the playstore this 
happens with, and I have tried hundreds. 3. The graphics are VERY dark, up 
to a point where at nigh time (in game) and in certain dungeons the screen 
is solid black, and when I adjust brightness high enough to see, the 
lighter parts of the screen are much too bright. This is on two separate 
devices and in every single IE game, stable and beta, PC and Android. The 
graphics have not been designed for LCD screens, and should have been 
adjusted properly. 4. The games in their current state are somewhat laggy 
on my two aforementioned tablets, which is fine, but the betas are 
practically unplayable in their current state. It's the worst lagfest I 
have encountered so far. I hope they get that fixed before the betas go 
live, but knowing the company's track record, I'm not holding my breath. 
Maybe they could offer the current versions as an alternative download... 
Otherwise it's refunds for 4 games. All in all these games themselves are 
some of the best games ever made, but their current and foreseeable future 
state is sadly less than amateurish in application.
replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for your feedback. Please, report back once the 2.5 patch is released if the experience is better for you.
Also, please, make sure you have reported the lagging and other issues at support.baldursgate.com - our bug tracker.

content: Did you love this game when it first came out? Is your phone the size of an immodest tablet?   If you answered "No" to either of these questions, this isn't for you. The UI is unintuitive and tiny. The voice acting is grating enough to process parmesan cheese and repetitive enough to repetitive enough to repetitive enough to make a broken record sound like a full-cast audiobook. The combat is unintuitive, but to be fair it's also clunky and bad.  In honest defense of this game, the world's depth and design is evident even so many years later. It's just a pity that insufficient effort was made to make this game accessible to players who grew up with other alternatives to the ol' hoop-and-stick. For instance, it's a mighty chore to figure out what a weapon's stats are, who can use what, and even whether one weapon is identical to another weapon. This was probably once attractive complexity, but today it's needless convolution.   Again, if you loved the original, you'll probably love this port. If you didn't, this will be like taking a 12-hour flight over the Pacific in the original Wright brother's aircraft.  There's just plain better ways to get where you're going.
replyContent:
Hello!

content: FOR NOTE 8 USERS  I was terribly worried about a lack of support. The last this was updated is in 2015 or so. I was worried about massive black bars on the side. Unreadable text, small buttons and no spen support.   I am happy to say you can play the game full screen (and it looks completely natural/not stretched) using the Samsung game tools to change the game to full screen.   Increase UI size to max ingame (even then it's kinda small)   Spen works great and is perfect for this game. Makes hitting the small UI buttons so much easier, I only use my fingers to zoom in and out (wish I could use the spen button for that)    P.s. the game is very old school, no hand holding. Even the "tutorial" is pretty confusing at times. But seriously five this a chance esp if you've never played CRPG's.

content: This is one of the best rpgs. It's a straight up classic of epic adventure, story, and character building. I cannot recommend this game and it's sequel enough.  As an aside, it's not good or  ( I feel ) meant for a phone. This is definitely a tablet game - it's because the ui is obviously meant for a commuter. So, the smaller the device, the more difficult it'll be to do anything.  It has nothing to do with the game itself, if was simply made for a larger screen.  It is an ode to the most classic RPGs,   though it may seem complicated, it eases you into the epic adventure. I can never recommend this game enough.

content: A great classic ported wonderfully to android!

For those of us with gaming tastes that are stuck in that window of time when it was still unfashionable, you should remember this game.  Beamdog has done an excellent job porting this, although if you are a purist who gets all... twitchy, when developers deviate from the original, be aware that they've added some new characters.  Also, the character creation process is markedly different than the original.  It's closer to Baldurs Gate II, but I actually approve of the changes. 1: New sub-classes (pretty much identical to BGII) 2: The total number of points available when rolling stats is now displayed after each roll, so if you're like me and spend 30 minutes re-rolling to get the highest spread possible, it's a huge help 3: New weapon and fighting style proficiencies are available  But wait, there's more!  Beamdog has included an arena where you can make an entire party and engage in fisticuffs with a cornucopia of savage bastards and monsters, all courtesy of this asshat of a Drow named Baeloth.  In an act of outrageous perfidy, he has placed a gaes on you and your kith that requires you to engage in bloodsport for his entertainment.  Good times¡
little tough to see at times and too tough to follow all the storylines. overall great game though.

I'm so impressed with the amount of effort put forth I bought BD: II, Icewind Dale and Planescape: Torment, as well. If Beamdog offered the APK file from their website, I would have purchased it directly from them. This game is phenomenal on the ASUS Zenpad S 8.0. Just one one Question/Plea: PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE offer "Siege of Dragons" PLEASE!!!

I LOVE this game.  It is true to the original with some extra stuff thrown in.  I have played only a few tabletop RPG games and don't fully understand the stats, like when to roll what, so going into this worried me with its complexities.  This game is great for a person interested in learning about RPG games and a seasoned veteran because fortunately it plays just like a tabletop RPG.  The computer is the DM and takes care of the "dice rolls" for you while you command your party and tell them what to do.  There are so many classes and side missions that this has more than enough replay value on top of its 60+ hours of campaigns.  Truly one of the best and most fun RPG games I have ever played and most in depth.
Just the nostalgia that me and my father can relive anywhere

Baldur's Gate on Android, with all the classes, races, in-game content (though not storyline obviously) of BG2, optimised for touch and playable anywhere. And what? We can copy our PC save game files onto our phones/tablets and play our favourite characters on the go? AND it's cross-platform capable, from Android to PC to iOS, with no bugs or connection dramas? Oh god, my life is complete.  I've been playing BG since I was a kid, and since I downloaded the Android version here in 2014, I've experienced virtually no problems or glitches. It's exactly the same game in every way, including the interface (which has of course been masterfully optimised for touch input). A couple AI scripts had bugs, once or twice quick spells showed an incorrect number of memorisations, minor stuff that wasn't constant or difficult. Over time every minor detail has become perfectly seamless. Definitely worth the wait, and the price.

Great to have a really good rpg for phones, i owned this and the 2nd on steam but its nice to have a good game to take with you. I will say its better for tablets, i have an s5 and i still feel its a little cramped, but worth it!

Game is basically perfect for someone looking for a rich story, notoriously challenging gameplay, deep character customization, & replayability. You make dialogue choices and choose everything about your character from the way he/she looks/sounds, to what skills they posess. You could be a prissy song playing bard or a badass weapon master. Every reasonable fantasy race and profession is in this game, from gnomes and halflings to half elfs & dwarves. Be whatever and whoever you want. Text is a bit small...

Not for casuals but anyone would enjoy it if they invested time.  A very long game but worth the investment as it is so entertaining.   The sequel is also good.  So is Icewind Dale though more combat focused.  Get this game it is very funny in places and simply one of THE best RPGs even made!!!

I am really enjoying the game. The graphics on my Nexus 10 are very nice. It loads quickly. It runs smoothly - most of the time.  So, why 4 stars instead of 5? Because it has a terrible tendency to crash. Most of the time, it runs fine. But it crashes often enough that I've had to develop the habit of pressing on the save button just before I try something risky, and also just after I succeed at something, such as getting to a town, or killing some enemies. This is on a Nexus 10.   The only other game that I can compare it with is "The Bard's Tale" and this is a bit more interesting because I can have companions (support personnel).   -- adding a minor update based on another review. I find it very helpful to "freeze" the game when I am directing individual characters, especially in a fight, to be sure that the character I want is selected, the proper weapon selected, and the target is correct. Sometimes this means looking really close, even on my 10in screen, to be double sure.

Technically, porting this game to touch screens is a brilliant idea. Unfortunately, touch-screen technology isn't what it could be (yet, anyways). Thus, you will find yourself missclicking on characters a lot, commands not being followed because they never registered, or the wrong character accepting commands because you didn't notice the game failed to change to the character you selected (this happens a lot due to getting complacent from the game properly picking up changes until the magical moment it doesn't). I find myself having to zoom in a lot, which is something I really dislike on a mechanics level, plus it breaks immersion. The game on its own is a masterpiece, and while I have my gripes about this port, it is definitely playable.

I love playing this on the Note 4. The UI improvements since this was initially released on iOS have made this a pleasure to play on a 6 inch device like the Note. I prefer the more hand-held experience over larger devices like my iPad. My favorite mobile game by far, probably until I get around to playing BGII on my phone. It would be nice to get feature parity with iOS. The recent 2 gb update seemed to just fix some bugs irrelevant to me. Still waiting on in-game save game transfer support, so deducting.

...and I have rarely been impressed with an Android app, much less a game. BGEE is a 2D isometric, turned based (mostly), RPG with hours and hours of game play. This app is a port of the (now abandoned?) BG computer program. BEAMDOG rewrote the Infinity Engine, but with many improvements and a lot of TLC, IMHO. This is a wonderful job and deserves your full support. You should get it and all the IAP content (because I really want BG2EE on Android too)! The IAP is not mandatory and though I usually avoid it like the plague, it is done right with this game. I fully recommend and endorse this port of Baldur's Gate. ADDED: Great fix with the fonts - many go smaller now, too. Custom Script screen still doesn't scroll correctly, though. Played on a 12.2" Samsung SM-T900 and 10.1" ASUS TF-700T. NEWEST: New build works fine with 5.1.1 - give them a chance folks! Google is making too many changes too fast (and bad choices). BTW, it works fine offline, too.

Love this game 5/5. To help with other comments you shouldn't need wifi to play SINGLE PLAYER. Multi player you may. To transfer your character from bg1 to bg2 you need to install a file manager app. Find com.beamdog.baldurs gate and click save file. Find your prefered save then move it to the same area on com.beamdog.baldursgate2 save folder. Open up baldurs gate 2 and import from the save file you imported. Hope this helped guys!

Can you save your progress on a cloud to be synced between multiple devices? I paid for this app and yet the free ones keep up with your progress better. I also want to know what, if anything, you can carry over from BG:EE 1 to BB:EE 2. If you can, how? If I can sync this between devices, I will go ahead and get the PC version as well. Just feel like the guys at Beamdog haven't progressed to 2015 where everything is mobile and linked to multiple devices. Until I find out how, unfortunately, this game will remain in my app drawer out of sight.

I can't read the text in the game is there a way to make it bigger either fix that or I want a refund
replyContent:
Hello,

If you open the Options menu and select Graphics, you can adjust the Font Size slider to your preference. Higher-resolution devices will definitely benefit from a larger font size.

Loved this game years ago and they've done an exemplary job of modifying the UI for touch screens, but I've encountered a bug where a (player) character raised at a temple comes back as an enemy. They don't attack or anything but I can't rest or leave the current area. I can't export them then reform the party either, there's no curse or status effect on them that I can remove either. This is pretty much a game breaker for this campaign.

Game plays very smooth, with no lags. Touch controls are well done and i haven't encountered any quest related bugs. It's good to see old BG back! The new content is also pretty ok. There are graphical bugs though, such as water and lava not showing up on my Nexus 7 running Lollipop. Beamdog is working on it, apparently. I will give it a 5 star rating after the water is fixed.

I myself am always looking for a good crew to run with and actually do some quests in game with NPCs. As a fan of evildoers everywhere Dorns side quests are amazing!!! it will not let me summon Demogorgon tho.... -1 star!

This is my second favorite game of all time, the other being Planescape. The New updates have vastly improved gameplay and the new characters are a nice touch here. The Black Pits are cool but short. I recommend core rules or higher for D&D players and Normal for new players. Despite the steep learning curve once you figure out how to do things the game is very fun.

So, I just completed the game. I have to say, this is probably one of the best RPGs I ever played. The added content really makes the game fun and even more interesting than I originally thought. Deserves a 5/5 and I haven't even played the sequel, which is known to be the best CRPG ever made.  On the tablet it was even somehow more interesting than I initially thought. The only downside was the UI and lack of captions for the buttons/items and some rare occasions when the game crashed all of the sudden. I always felt a bit forced to hold my finger on the magic scrolls and items to confirm what I was doing. Maybe some kind of popup caption for these items would be nice, I am sure this can be done somehow. Maybe having a ""magnifier" button, which once pressed can be used as a tool to invoke pop-up name or explanations of buttons and items in question.  Also some critical triggers in the game are not highlighted, which causes some confusion and forces the player to look at a "let's play" or "walk-through" on what to press. For instance the "biers" in Durlag's Tower. I did not have a clue what to do on the second and the fourth level, because the triggers were not highlighted.

First off, if you're familiar with the franchise and want this on your tablet. Get it. 'nuff said. For those of you (like myself) who missed out on playing BG in its prime, yet love true class driven, complex party types of RPGs, get this NOW.  For some background, even though I always loved RPG games, I missed out on BG when it came out (I think I was occupied RTS games at the time.) When I got back into computer RPGs, I jumped into all the Elder Scrolls games, then Dragon Age, and others along the way. And although those were fun and great games, they missed 'the feel,' in one or another, of what I wanted - more of a classic D&D experience.   This game is not flashy and is not an action RPG. What drew me in is the depth of class creation possibilities coupled with the myriad of party setups you could have with the NPCs. Put it this way, I've barely even started this game and already have multiple save files since I'm not even sure what class, mutli-class, or dual class I want to play. If you ever thought "I miss pen and paper RPGs" then just get started with this game already.    The only negative is the time this game sucks from your life :)

My advice to you? If you are looking for an old-school RPG experience, stop reading the reviews and buy this right now. I tried this briefly on a Galaxy Tab 8, and while it was pretty good (except for poor battery life), I think this game is an absolute must-have for anyone with a Galaxy Note 4. The screen makes the graphics look really bright and vibrant, battery life is excellent, and the load times are instantaneous. The interface is a little small on the Note 4's screen, but the stylus (especially with the hover cursor on) dramatically improves the experience, making precision clicking a breeze. This is rapidly becoming the game I have invested the most hours into on a mobile device. There's a couple of awkward interface choices that were clearly made as a concession to having the touch interface and a lack of keyboard, but overall it plays exceptionally well. I've only experienced one crash while playing when loading a new area, but it wasn't too far past an auto-save, still hit that quick-save button often! A note to Beamdog... Any chance of using the S Pen hover for tooltips? Also: PLEASE release Baldur's Gate II: EE!! I will buy it the day it comes out!!

The textures are slightly sharper it not sharp enough to be considered equal to today's technology. And when you're asking such a high price for a premium title you expect premium content. All of the add-ons should have been in it for free for 10 buck's

Saw this on the play store and couldn't buy it fast enough. Loved my original pc version. Started game up and looked great during tutorial. Then the cinematic cutscenes. I can hear sound, but no picture except a shredded multi-colored video that resembles scrambled porn. Looked up any way to fix the issue using game options and phone options and didn't find anything. Will rate higher if someone has a fix cause at the moment I feel I wasted my money.
Thank you for reviving this old classic. Loving it on my tablet.

There are multiple language for dialogues but sound/voice are only english... thats sad :( I miss the old french voices. I would buy the old french packages audio.

Awesome to be able to play this classic on my phone whenever I want. Totally worth the money considering all the extra features. Text and UI are a little small, but I imagine it's made for screens a tiny bit bigger. Still excellent. Galaxy S5. Please give us BGII and Neverwinter Nights soon!

The original game when installed on PC asks you if your cpu is over or under 200mhz..... yet many years and mhz later it proves to be better then most games coming out for phone and even PC.  Sad state of affairs but good news is its here. Buy it. Play it. Realize what good content bring to a game over the flashy graphical shells of games that are pumped out for a quick buck. My advice to anyone playing on something smaller then a tablet: get a stylist. Makes for perfect play on my note 3. Google EEkeeper.

This is truly an epic classic, and it is awesome to be able to play it on my HTC One M8. In addition to the cool extra content, the graphic and tactile interface is really optimized for a touch screen, even one as small as on a phone.

Works flawlessly on my Note 4. Using the Note Pen makes the game easy to play. Was easy to pick up and begin playing right away as I am very familiar with all the old IE games. I have noticed the nice touches like a quick save button on the side. 6 hours into the game at time of review, if I hit any game stopping bugs will update. For anyone new to Balder's Gate, be warned that this is an old school game from another era, I strongly urge finding the pdf manual and reading the whole thing.

Runs great, loads of nostalgic fun. Runs on the android galaxy nexus 4. Aside from my thumbs being a little big and hard to click things sometimes. But my thumbs are not the mouse pointer from this old 1999 pc game conversion to android. Totally worth the 10 dollars.

content: I almost gave up on android and the direction hardcore gaming on the mobile OS is taking. We're going towards free to play freemium games where ads rule the screen and where at least a fourth of the game is locked off unless you pay. Beamdog, you are my hero. This is a quality port that's worth every penny of the 9.99 I paid. I liked it so much I even purchased the extra features (voice and art packs and extra characters). Let this be the standard for future Android ports/ gaming. Then game quality will be the selling factor rather than locking game  content and relying on advertisement. I can't wait for the second port.
This is a great game but is not designed for small screens.  It is very difficult to play on a phone screen, even a 5" one.  Regret purchasing this since I don't have a  larger tablet to play it on.
Game is awesome

When you escape out into baldurs gate and have to avoid the flaming fist guards,  your hud disappears and are therefore unable to select spells,  skills,  multiple party members or indeed anything else... I've loved this game since 98 and this bug is unacceptable... Please fix. Edit : bug addressed
replyContent: This bug has been fixed. Try again after downloading the latest update!

replyContent: We've added support for bluetooth keyboards in our latest update. Additionally, we have addressed a number of multiplayer issues and syncronized the version number across platforms to ensure maximum cross-platform compatibility for multiplayer. Try again after downloading the latest patch update!

content: What I said before: "And font size is too small on Galaxy Note 3 (it suggests lazy port). Add a setting to increase font size, or autodetect device, and I'll raise my rating from two stars. Many devs respond to subpar ratings by assuring they'll fix the reported problem. I hope I don't regret my $10 purchase."  Devs added font size mod! Now the game is easily playable on Note 3! I've played BG for years (I still have the CDs), and this is a great extension to mobile. Great job!

Baldur's Gate is easily the best rpg on Android. A complete pc port with easy, albeit small, touch screen controls. Though this can be remedied with a font size ini tweak. Great game. Keep on adventuring!   Update: The developers heard our complaints about the small text and the recent update allows you to select a comfortable text size. Thanks for listening!

So far so good. Only complaint is lack of sd card support.  I freed up space on internal memory thinking I could transfer to sd card after install,  which I could but only 30mb transferred :(.
I never thought i'd play so many hours on a tiny screen. Im playing on an LG G2. The game is perfect! I like that you can slide the difficulty level to your liking. Im addicted!!!
Fantastic Port W/ Cross Platform Support
This how PC conversation should be done!
Game crashes every time I try and get through the tutorial. I just tried for the 15th time.....and crash again. Please refund my 10 dollars or get this fixed. Truly frustrating.

Thank you for bringing this back and to Android!
with bigger font works great on phone now as promised 5 stars

I endorse this app or game  The ability to use a keyboard and mouse on the Android version is pretty useful. This game is much better with that type of setup. Combines with an MHL adapter to connect it to a TV/Monitor...
A very good port of the original.  Works perfectly on my asus transformer prime.  Recommended for any rpg fan.
A cloud save feature thats compatible across PC -Android - iOS would be fantastic. Sometimes I want to play on my phone then sometimes on my tablet, having the same save across those devices.
Wow - plays very well and looks great. Quite daunting with so much on offer. Devs took a long time to bring it to android but so far i would say the wait was worth it.
Best game
Love it! Can't wait for BG2!
Works fine

I played this game when it first came out on PC this is an exact replication with hands down the best mobile game I've yet to play. The s5 helps with the screen size but now the update fixes that issue. I have no qualms except that I'm addicted have a hard time putting it down. However it does very well on the battery with how long I play it. Thanks for the game can't wait for BG2!
The game itself has been an amazing port. Thank you for the font changes. Seriously keep up the good work.
No more magnifying glass. Thanks for fixing that.
Great job Beamdog! Can't wait for BG2 for my Android!
Excellent port, would love to see BG2 ported to Android as well
Best rpg on appstore hands down, worth the money.
Nostalgia. Just like playing the PC game.
EDIT: It took a while, but the latest update addressed my only complaint. The new font options are awesome. Thanks.
promised the 5 stars w big text so here it is.  GREAT JOB! Can't wait to get into the game!
Development took a lot longer than I expected, but excellent results and ongoing support have proven beamdog to be among the finer companies currently involved in video game (re) development.
I loved this game on the PC and now I can enjoy it on my phone! Runs great on the Galaxy S5 active!
Port plays well. They did it justice.
A fantastic port of a great game

It was the top rpg 15 years ago; and it is now still one of the best rpg in google play! Not many titles come close. Interesting storyline, non linear gameplay, huge world, deep character customization, excellent spell system, good graphics, cool items, and all other things you would wish for in an rpg. Choose your friends, form your own party, adventure into this mystical world of the sword coast! Great port, runs almost flawlessly on my note2, just wish the dialouge fonts are bigger though.
Needs bigger font and buttons
I love playing Baldurs gate. And i cant wait for Icewind dale and Baldurs gate 2. This is the best remake of all time.
I love that the first RPG I ever played can be revisited in this format.
Brilliant,  just how I remembered it. There needs to be more games like this with actual depth, not like though's poxy arcade games!
Great redux,  sorta,  of a classic

im using the new samsung tab 4, had a real hard time getting the game to start up without crashing... like others have said dont use the back key or it will crash. one problem is the game is 2.6gbs. if you wanted to see if it will work on your system you have to be able to download it in under 15 minutes which is pretty much trash.... when it does work so far looks nice has voice in some cases, others it text reading, not a problem on the tab 4. the tutorial does seem to be buggy. crashed in char make mode, one time when my bluetooth keyboard turned on. anything that may open another app when this is running seems to crash the game. will test this more.
Amazing game, would love cloud save... I change phones all the time
Loads of fun. Lots of quest. Just needs some slightly better graphics but overall a real good game for the money.

Waited to play this on my n7 for quite a while. Wish I never bought it. Not only is there no improvement in graphics from the original they also managed to make it no fun at all. Absolute waste of 10$. Will never buy another beamdog product again.
Visual problems on both devices that I have tried it on. On my RCA tablet the text is illegible. The dialogue is clear on my smart phone but the characters and map are entirely too small.
Thank you for bringing this classic to my phone! Will wait for BG2:EE to become available on Android.

When the app opens it defaults to landscape and works fine. If I minimize the game then come back it tries to force portrait mode. However the graphics are all skewed and the touch screen stops working. It becomes unplayable.
Is there any option to make the font bigger as it's hard to read even on a big phone, please can I get a response thanks.

Like many, the first time I played BG back in the day, I was astonished at the technical marvel, the story, the characters, the rich dialogue and most of all CHOICE that this game presents.  2 things...1, inherent issues with touch controls, not the developer's ault, but it can be hard to accurately do something. Countering that though, the developer's EXCELLENT execution of pinch zooming. 2...I found a bug, that I have not found mentioned even on the official forums. If you are looting a corpse or container and your inventory is full, a long press on the item to be looted appears to destroy it. I foolishly assumed that it went to the next character's backpack, and upon returning to the town, nobody in my party had the quest items, they had not been dropped, just vanished...attach BT keyboard, mod ini file and bring up console (CTRL+Enter) to add the missing items if this happens to you (lists all over the place online of console commands and item codes). Excellent, best game on android currently, and I don't say that carelessly.
One of the best games ever and now even better.
This is my favorite RPG of all time and I'm thrilled that I can take it to go.  I have both EEs on steam but I bought the tablet version for a flight to Seattle.  Looooooove!
Old school cool!

Piece of crap it locked up my brand new Galaxy 5S 10 minuits into the game. I am currently stuck in the tutorial because it doesn't register the spell that I am supposed to cast to move onto the next part of the quest.

After gettin to the part where belt tells you there is one last test, I can't do anything but walk around, and he won't talk to me.  Also the cutscenes do not play at all the screen goes pixelated and then skips them.
As great as it was to play when it came out all those years ago. Go for the eyes Boo!
So happy to be playing this classic again, looking forward to the sequal
It's such a deep rpg that anyone if the genre would love, it reminds me so much of kotor. Plays perfect on HTC one m8
Buggy

I'm playing on a Galaxy note 2 and i find the screen too small. Still playable but you may consider installing it on a tablet. Sometime it's impossible to open doors. The first bug appear in the friendly arm inn (first house at the left), making it impossible to finish the return the ring quest. Second bug appear in baldur's gate, in the thief guild. It's impossible to access the second floor. Still I've been able to finish the game. I recommend this game! For the Dev team: Please fix these bugs!!!

I loved BG in high school and I love it even more now.  It's the prefect distraction.  The depth of the story and the characters sucks you in.  It's amazing how much time you can sink into this game.  Runs very well on my Galaxy S5.
Baldur's Gate

Playing on a Nexus 5, having a hard time progressing. Ask to have an item identified = crash, leave or enter an Inn = crash. Makes progression a chore - hope this can be fixed.  Developers - would it be possibly to slightly enlarge the pause button - take multiple taps for it to register sometimes.
Text is to small, a font of 1 on my s5.
Best ever
Please fix it ASAP...
I am so excited this game was one of my favorites growing up
Way too small to play on a phone.
replyContent: We've added a font size configuration to the game's Graphics Options menu, which makes it a lot easier to read the text on smaller screens.

content: It's bg, bg owns

I started a new game, created my character and finished the tutorial after which, it goes back to the main menu? This is on a nexus 7 tablet.  BTW, I own this game for the PC, Mac and iOS, where this doesn't occur.  Update: I was able to get this to work by starting a new game from scratch. Still this should've been more polished.
Crashes to home screen when starting main campaign.

It really annoys me that press and hold on a quick bar spell/ability doesn't tell you what it is.  So you have to keep looking them up in the mage scroll thing, which takes forever. Please add some sort of labels.

First time through this game. Just started. Would like to note the "Journal" gives me some troubles.  It will periodically stop letting me click on quests and I have to restart to get it to work again. Any help would be appreciated. Other than that. Beautiful work.
Just like the PC version only cooler because its touch controlled
Still just as fun and i love the touch screen
Great rehash of an old favorite love it
Best thing ever. This game works so well on a touch scree n is like the game was made for it. Hope they come out with bg2 and Ice wind Dale

I'm a long time gamer and this version is as good on the computer I still use to play on! I hope more classic games such as BG are ported or whatever conversion process has been done with this game! I believe strongly that life will be revived bring classic games to the smart phone and younger users experiencing what base foundations that impacted games being developed to this day.
Bring the second on soon!!!
Great game! Loved it as a teenage and now I can take it with me everywhere!
Orite game... So i'm giving it 5 stars
Horrible interface

Love this game. Depth in story, character and game play. Hours and hours of gaming. No ads. A few IAPs but they are fully optional and are not required to progress through the game. I would far rather pay £6 for a full game than spend 10s of pounds on useless in app currency in order to progress to the next level. Dungeon Keeper anyone? I rest my case...
I want BG 2 now!
I loved this game on pc and now its in my pocket. No issues so far and played a good 4 hours. A must for any old skool rpg gamer.

I was expecting to have some issues with the UI due to the fact that I'm playing on a nexus 5, and thus a mere 5 inch screen. I was wrong. Controls surprisingly well and a zoom function ensures that I can see the action clearly. Bravo! I will definitely be purchasing BG2EE upon release.
I find it crashes too much. I have to save every few minutes because I'm tired of playing the same thing over and over. It should have a save state. So I can return where I left off.
Epic game

content: Time to Hack'n'Slash, and let dices deside the outcome. A must have game for DnD gamers.
It's almost better playing on my note 3 than it was on the pc. Hopefully BG2 is released for Android as well. I just wish you could keep playing after you beat the game.

replyContent: We've added a font size configuration to the game's Graphics Options menu, which makes it a lot easier to read the text on smaller screens.

content: Whilst the quest of the unopenable door continues to frustrate me, there's quite a good nostalgic kick to be found here, forgot how hard this game could be lel. Not perfect, but good.
Works amazing on a big phone I have the galaxy s5 and It would be a pain if it was any smaller I love this rpg they never make rpgs like this anymore A+
When is Bg2 coming to android?  And I'm having issues with my party not entering  house's occasionally such as the one on the inside of the drawbridge in friendly arm
Love the game but it keeps freezing. It takes the fun out of it.

I have this for windows.  I also bought it for android, hoping to do multiplayer.  It doesn't work because the windows version number and the tablet version numbers are different.  This is with the latest versions installed on both.  Even among android tablets, multiplayer doesn't doesn't work because the game has a different version number for each tablet model i.e. a Nexus 7 won't connect with a Nook HD.  Bottom line:  All tablets for multiplayer must be exactly the same.  Requesting my money back.
replyContent: Several multiplayer issues have been addressed in our latest update, resulting in a much smoother experience. All platform versions have been synced to ensure maximum cross-platform compatibility. Try again after downloading the latest update!

content: A long time coming, but the only killer app for a tablet.

Am enjoying BG so much that I just bought a larger tablet for play. On my current 7" screen the text is barely readable. The game is confusing for a first time player but after reading several online walkthroughs for the PC version I'm getting better. Hope BG2 will also be available for Android.
Great game
Thanks!
Too dark and almost unplayable on a tablet. Wish i could get my money back.
Fallout 2,  BG2, never winter nights, and the Ice Wind Dale series have got to be done!!!! Other than That very awesome
Seems like a game I would love unfortunately ui way too small how to increase it unplayable for me would like if this is nonfixable.
Wow what a conversion I never thought in million years I'd be playing this classic on my phone. Game works well only downside is buttons on s3 are small but I dont care love this game great job :)

A must for any fans of GURPS, Pathfinder, D&D, and anyone who likes good games in general. One of the first benchmarks of its kind,   holding a tried and true seat in      the pantheon of classic art.
Woot
There are a few small game issues, and some graphics problems with water, but otherwise this game is perfect.
Reminds me of the old game. Awesome. Try it.

Overall, a good transfer of the pc game to android.  There are some minor issues (opening some doors, scalps disappearing from inventory on save) that need to be addressed.  Plus the game aborted after finishing the mine quest.  Restared, however, and continued.  This game is NOT optimal for play on phones.

This game is full of bugs, got to final test of tutorial only to find it won't load. Can't continue with game. Have alrneady done character creation twice as game crashes when minimised on my tablet. Sure its a good game once it works but fed up that I paid £7
replyContent: We have fixed the bug causing the game to crash when minimized. Try again after downloading the latest patch update!

content: Can't wait for part 2.
Worked brilliantly on tab 10.1 just waiting for the sequel

A truly excellent RPG based on AD&D 2nd edition rulebooks! Looks good and runs smoothly on T-Mobile Note 3. Amazing depth of gameplay second to none in it's genre on Android!  Overall a great port! Steep learning curve requires patience and maybe a little research for the uninitiated however. This is basically a full port of the PC version!
Crashes on my Galaxy Note 2 a lot. More so when I am waylaid for some reason. Would like a refund or maybe send me a link for the pc download so I can try on that. Sweet game though. Classic.
Great port of a classic. Been playing it non stop just like back in the day. Cant wait til the developer ports BG 2!!!

I purchased this game because it's one of my all time favorite games. As it turns out on my galaxy 3 mini I can't read or click correctly due to the size of the game, not only that but it constantly freezes about every 5 mins. When I requested a refund they never replied to me or fixed my issues.
replyContent: We've added a font size configuration to the game's Graphics Options menu, which makes it a lot easier to read the text on smaller screens.

content: I bought the original when it came out, and this remake makes it even better. The touch interface and portability of the Android platform are perfectly suited to Baldur's Gate, and it is very fun to play. Sometimes getting in certain doors is troublesome (Joia's house in the Friendly Arm Inn), but otherwise it runs and plays great. I can't wait for the second one to hit the Play Store!
I remember my parents playing this game when I was younger and its the same as it was back then and I love it

Well then that brings back memories! Great game but hard to play on your phone. Although I play it on my note 2 (because of the stylus)  it's really meant for a bigger device. Wish there was a pinch to zoom in and out. Would make it so much easier to navigate through the game. And it's hard to get in and out of some doors I've noticed. Overall, I'm happy with spending the money and would pay even more for icewindale!!
No crashes, and plays perfectly.
One or two doors take a while to get through  but otherwise plays very smooth on s3 loved this game in high school

Playing as monk and encountered a big m bug during the tutorial... When Belt asks me to equip a dagger and I do it he still keeps on stating I haven't equipped it... What can I do now? Uninstalled... Can I still get a refund??
Games great just wish you could make the letters bigger  kind of difficult to read
It would be difficult to find a better game for your phone/tablet. Runs flawlessly on my Xperia. Cannot wait for BG2.
So glad baldurs gate is on droid. One of my favs.
The text is so small it makes playing the game impossible.   Any chance of a refund?
This is bg original.  Not enhanced.  Kind of a let down after 10$!
Doesnt work on S3
Great port, would like to see more late 90's pc games ported to android.
Love this game thank you thank you thank you. Now please do Baldur gate 2, Iceland Dale 1 and 2 and maybe gold box (pool of radience)from back in the day. ID buy em all.....worth every penny.

Someone please tell me how to fix this or I will be asking for my money back.
replyContent: We've addressed this issue in the latest update. Please let us know if it still doesn't start for you.

content: I've been wondering if anyone would ever convert these games for use on smart phones. Love it! Works great on my GS3.
This is the game I grew up playing on windows 98. It's great it's been revived and brought to Android!
Worth every penny, even the in app purchases. Works perfect on my note 3 as well as my Kindle fire HDX that I sideloaded Android onto.
The fmv are not playing correctly, they are off centre (pushed down). If there is a fix for this would happily score 5 as it plays as you would expect it to :-\
One of my all time favourite games now fits in a jacket pocket? yes please :D  Game-play is great playback is smooth videos and sounds just like I remember.
Aside from the small text, this game is excellent. Really loving playing it on my s4, great job
One of the greatest RPGs of all time. The port works perfectly on my nexus7 and can be considered the best RPG on the play store.

I've played PC versions of this game, and this one actually improves on them. Touch interface is perfect, and you can save anywhere the PC game allows. I hope more are ported to Android... I would definitely purchase them!
Love this game having trouble defeating last boss.  I'm using a galaxy s 3

Great, everything is there from the PC version. Would give 5 stars if the font size could be changed for smaller screen. The game is perfect on my tablet, but text is hard to read on my phone. It be great to play on the train and at lunch.
Totally worth the wait!!
If I exit the game and re enter the app is is squished to half of the screen. I have to kill the app to fix it. Please fix.
Just like when I played baldur's gate as a kid.
Awesome guys thanks a lot so many good memories. Best thing I ever put on my phone. Do neverwinter nights next :) please.
Game consistently froze on start up. Very frustrating. Using a nexus 7. Complete waste of my money. Buyer beware!!!
Flawless on Galaxy S4.  A nostalgia trip that manages to be better than many new games.
Plays better than I expected. Very good fun
Spent £7 on a game I can't even play.  Crashes out whenever I try to start either the tutorial or the main game.  Fix or refund!

Great port, but a little unpolished. Had issues with in game video on android 4.1. Couldn't find the dragonbane sling in durlag's tower and now I'm stuck after you are put in prison. The short weird guy in the cell let's me out and I have no ui. Can't beat the game. Running kitkat now.

Game starts, and I began to create a character. However part way through the game stopped and all I get is a block screen now, even after rebooting the device.   Any idea how to fix this, or should I just get a refund?             Edit: No response. Can I have a refund, please?
Despite never playing the PC version I found the Android edition to be faultless. Excellent game with quite some  replayability (especially using multiplayer without guests)

I got so hooked on this game that I have lost a lot of sleep playing it so far... Absolutely recommended if you like old school RPGs. Worth every penny and more, don't hesitate buy this so they put out more!

This is the full ported game. And it works really well. No crashes. One bug that has to do with screen rotation. But it's easily solved with going to the home screen and then back to the app. (This bug only occurs if you switch from the game to a different app repeatedly). A solid purchase. Worth the money definitely.

Using a galaxy S4, sometimes the writing can be hard to make out and occasionally getting through a door becomes a chore. Also had a couple times when talking to bartenders the game completely freezes. BUT. .. These aren't very big things, this is a sixty hour epic game, a proper game for gamers. The Lil bugs I can overlook, but is extremely difficult to pick up if you haven't played anything like it before, but once you get the hang of it, it's just a great game, on any device.
Great job.... make sequels please.
Must for fans of the genre

Seriously love this game and can not wait until the next one comes out. The only bad thing is some of the maps get stuck and its hard to get out of little shops. Other than the occasional hiccup it is superb. This game brings back a lot of memories from my child hood. As an adult it is much more enjoyable. I really can't say enough good about this port. Now if only we could get a Fallout port I would be in heaven.

I love the game, I remember playing it back when it first came out and many times over since. It's a bit buggy, if I accidentally minimize it the screen display is massively cramped and... my biggest peeve is that I purchased the additional portraits but the game crashed right as the transaction went through. I now cannot get the portraits despite payment being accepted. I can't repurchase them either. Please make a restore purchase button and I'll happily increase my rating up to a 5!
I've been looking forward to this for so long. This is the way the interface should always have been.

Was really looking forward to a playing one of my favourite games ever on android, but all text was missing on the title screen, so impossible to navigate. After a bit of trial and error I managed to start the game, but all characters were just black rectangles. Please help, looking forward to playing the game,  and £6.99 is a complete waste  of money for a game you can't play! Samsung galaxy tab 3, 8"

But I haven't got that far yet, because it locks up resuming from sleep, and one of the biggest reasons I wanted this on android was so I could play a bit at a time. As it stands, be really careful to save before using the screen lock. (Nexus 7)
replyContent: We have fixed the bug causing the game to crash when minimized. Try again after downloading the latest patch update!

content: Great to see the port on android but it is downright unplayable the toolbar on the left side with my inventory and spells and everything dissapears as soon as I talk to a merchant and if I switch out of the app on my phone the game crashes. Half the time. Please fix or refund but I would prefer fix also have had numoreous random crashes can't get more then a few minutes in but I want to.
Favorite game of all time executed beautifully

Work very well and run smoothly. Very easy-to-play use a touchscreen. The only drawbacks are that you can't easily orient your party to a specific direction.  The other problem is the maps; it's hard to get the name pinpoint to  show.  Else really great.

Put together very well. Only problem on the LG enact is the font is so tiny it's hard to read. Still love it though. Other than that it's better than the original pc version I played back in the day. A+ thumbs up
The best rpg ever

Still contains the luck-bug.
Works perfect on my Nexus 5!

Still have issues with this game n which is sad cause I did pay n for it and kinda would expect to have little is no errors... hopefully the developers will release a fix for this issue at some point.

Too many bugs In this version. Entering nashkel everyone wants to fight, I can't talk to them, then my companions leave because I'm apparently evil for defending myself. This is not the same as the original. There is some scripting error. I've stated this for months and still no fix. I want my money back.

Honestly I loved this game on pc so it stands to reason I would love it on android, but they did a superb job in translating it to this smaller hardware. It runs well and at least on tablets perfectly.  I've recently lost my tablet ( *broke) so I'll have to see if my phone can use it but regardless a GREAT game translation
Had hours playing my favourite game as a kid, only negative i have found is the game crashing if i lose rep too quickly. Preventing me from finishing the game. Plz fix i really wanna finish it
Plays well on my gs3. Going to get it on my wife's phone for some     co-op. Brings back memories of my computer and i at night. Bring on bg 2!!
It Rocks
So very happy to be playing this on android finally, runs great and plays well. Let's see more deep/awesome games like this on here.
Just as I remembered
This is exactly the game i have been looking for all this time !!!! Thank you so much for making it happen : )
Xperia z1 and it doesn't even start up. Force closes. Tried rebooting and restarting. Please fix.
Every time I play it shuts down with a fatal error if I click the bottom right 3 spells errror. Using a SG5
Loved the PC version back in the day, this is even better
A classic RPG adventure. Having issues completing the download. It stalls right at the 2.07 GB mark and does nothing. I have plenty of storage space. Any advice would be great.
Great port of an amazing rpg.Seems that some dialogue was taken out not sure but still the amazing game it was.Love it
Too bad the text is to small to read on my tablet, let alone my phone. Fix the text size issue in Android and it's a five star rating!!!
It's challenging but still fun

i just removed this piece of garbage buttons are too unresponsive, the so called tutorial is losey does not tell you what bottun they want you to hit just the name. if you dont hit the buttons right or not fast enough the future party members just complain and complain untill you do. google get my money back now!!!!!

Was a great game, i'm a baldurs gate player and i really happy with this game. But i'm stuck at tower of durlag, i cant press the statue. Fix it and i give u 5 stars. Was waiting for the shadow of amn and throne of baal too.

Great port. It's a dream come true to play this game on Android. I'm not having the trouble others are complaining about. Thank you for not making it tablet-only. It runs remarkably well and isn't the battery or memory hog I would have expected. The touch controls are great. Please release more games like this (eg. Neverwinter Nights)
replyContent: It does, at least for now. We have a fix coming.

content: My favorite old school rpg on my phone 👌👌👌👌

Played BG2 on PC years back and was quite fond of it. Surprised to find a remake of BG1 with enhancement on the Android.  Bought it partly for nostalgia and partly to encourage port of quality games from yester-years. Was prepared to play using my Galaxy Note 3 but thought of 1st trying on my 2+ year old Galaxy Note 10.1 (not the new version). Was presently surprised that the game is as polished as the PC version that I remembered and extremely stable. I'm into chapter 4 and the game has not crashed once!

Absolutely perfect. Plays great with the stylus of the Galaxy note, no problems with doors etc. Very occasional lockup can be solved with quick save/load in a few seconds. Can't wait for bg2ee on android.
Plays well on my galaxy note3
New life for an old game. Awesome!  Runs great and looks beautiful on my Galaxy Tab 12.2".

My fav old school rpg.  port is perfect in every way except for one thing...text size on phone is impossible to read.  However, you can google the edit fix required to increase text size in the .ini file.  I followed what people said to do and can confirm that the text is now readable.  I am in heaven:)

When I switch back from another app the touch screen is often unresponsive and it can be hard to enter buildings sometimes but perfect port otherwise. I'd give it five stars if it wasn't for those problems.  Galaxy s4
Love the game..

There's a few buildings I cannot get into..mainly,  by friendly arm inn..the doors on left  side...I open, then try to go in, and they close..every time...I looked it up, its a quest..woman crying over her dead husband or some such thing, killed by hobgoblins...any chance you can fix this on android next book tablets so we can turn it in? Ty, awesome game otherwise, looking forward to bg2
replyContent: The bug preventing you from entering the house next to the Friendly Arm Inn and completing Joia's Ring quest has been fixed. Try again after downloading the latest patch update!

content: The game keeps quitting after defeating the final character
Started once, after that continuously crashing my note8. Can't refund. Lovely!

3rd run through problem in durlags tower... teleport room won't work...the crazy switch room...hard as hell to get right switch to open door...do they make a 2 micron touch stylus. ....or can I train a nat to help me play..mmmm Love the game difficult but not impossible to play on galaxy s4.....tablet would be easier
I'm still in awe that a game of this size and quality is playable on a phone. Hands down the most amazing piece of technological genius
I have been a fan of this series since 1998. I prefer the pc version, but being able to play on the go is amazing. Makes the Galaxy Mega all worth it.
Great game that is nicely ported from its older self. Doesn't handle multitasking at all which is annoying.
I truly enjoy this game on my s3, im hoping to see bg2 and maybe even the old fallout games brought back to life, they were fun and I would pay for them as well, im looking forward to more additions

One of the greatest game I've played remastered for my phone/tablet !! Up to now everything is fine for me !!

Wonderful game. Takes some time getting used to the old school art, figuring out what everything means and whatnot. Buggy as hell though, quite frustrating.
Great to have my all time favorite RPG with me wherever I go!
One of the best RPG's ever. Bring the BG2 please!
Amazing control with S-Pen

I've been searching for a good Baldur's Gate-styled game on Android for a while now. While I've found a few decent ones, you can't beat actually playing Baldur's Gate on Android. Little was sacrificed in bringing this onto portable devices. The only bad thing I can say so far, is that it's a bit difficult to select characters and background tasks. Especially on a smartphone. This is usually easily fixed by zooming in however, and I gladly do so to keep the authenticity of this fantastic game. I'm very surprised how faithful this port is. Keep up the good work! You have a surefire purchase from me if you should do any of the other Forgotten Realms pc games in the future (BG2, Neverwinter Nights, Planescape...hint, hint, PLEASE!).
Works great on a Samsung S II..... Only the text size is barely legible, even with a magnification of 2.5x. zooming function would be great.

Playing on a Samsung tab pro 8.4.  Game runs perfectly and contrary to my thoughts going in, the interface works very very well on a tablet.  It also works well on my phone but if it's very hard to race the text.   But if you have a tablet, i recommend itwithout any reservations at all.
Like REALLY
Amazing.

content: It takes MORE the 15 mins to install on WiFI , then its a pig that crashes and you can't refund. So disappointed.

I had already been playing BG1 and 2 using the GemRB application on my phone and quite honestly they worked decently.  But the enhanced edition is tailored to work very well with touch controls or mouse (I have a Galaxy S3 with a usb cable to plug in a mouse if I want).  The enhanced edition is worth the purchase although it'll be awhile before BG2 enhanced comes out on android, so until then, I play BG2 with the GemRB application.  Next stop - Planescape Torment Enhanced!
Paid ten bucks, times out before game even starts. Try working the bugs out before taking people's money.
One of my all time favorite games... now on my tablet! Can't wait for BGII!
Great game!!! A couple of minor glitches here and there. Would be nice if the text was a little bigger. I can't wait for BG2!

This is a very well port from PC to android - I haven't stumbled upon any bugs yet although I had hoped the pathfinding of the AI might would've gotten an overhaul with the enchanted edition which does not seem to be the case.
Beautiful
Some crashes.

It has been many years since I completed this on the PC and am glad to say it has lost none of it's original charm now it is on my nexus 7.  A fantastic RPG that works much better on a touch screen, for example one finger can pick an item up and another finger drops it at its destination almost instantly, no dragging across the screen needed!  The load times are very fast and they have also added pinch to zooming.  Out of the countless hours played so far, there has been only once this has crashed out back to the home screen.  I am thoroughly impressed with this high quality purchase and eagerly await the next installment BG2, which was even better than BG1!  Many thanks to the awesome developers who have successfully made this a  massive joy to play on the go!
Great Game!!  A must for classic RP gamers!!!
I paid for it, but it never downloaded to my phone. That's sucks

It just becomes a plain screen and I cant select a character or look in my inventory or anything else. Has anyone else had this problem? I have a samsung galaxy s3 tablet. Please help me?

Games have evolved over the years, and st first glance this game is ugly, cumbersome, boring, and clunky...but after you actually get to understanding how it works, playing it right and not like a modern button mash hacker, you realize this game is ridiculously deep, beautifully remastered, and makes you wish for more games like this in a modern engine. Overall this isn't just worth the 18 bucks for all content, its shocking that I didn't have to pay 40...well not really but its worth it. Pick it up

content: This was not made for touch, obviously since it is a classic game. No enhancements have been made for mobile and clicking and interacting on the phone screen is painful and clumsy. Not worth $1 let alone $10.

Amazing port!   I see some reviews claim this game was hard to learn, but I had no problems.  One of the best early D&D PC games faithfully executed in mobile.  I would definitely say this game is for tablets rather than phones as it can be difficult tapping the character you want on a small screen.  My only gripe is that the video cut scenes are screwed up for some reason, but that has no impact on game play.   Worth every penny!
Great RPG

I bought this game because of nostalgia. Haha. My only problem is not being able to see what spells I am casting, only symbols, which makes it pretty unplayable. I asked for a refund, but haven't heard back from anyone.
replyContent: You can long-tap on a spell's icon from the gameplay screen to view its description. We've improved this functionality to make it a bit more responsive now.

content: port of the brilliant original 1998 video roleplaying game with significantly improved user interface. works very well on my 1024x600 7in screen tablet.
About 6 hours in and everything is flawless so far. Exactly how I remember the game years ago. Works very well with the S Pen.

So far, so good.  Had some user error problems with the install at first, but it works great on the S3.  It's missing some pictures for customization, but the pics are small enough that you won't see them that often anyway.   The interface is a little different than I remember, but then again, it's been 15 years, hasn't it?  Well, the future is here.  We can beam this game to our phones.  I'm running an S3 with CM, it actually works unlike some games (cough GTA).
Plays really well on my 7" tegra tablet with a stylus, no complaints. Could be tricky to play on a smaller screen with touch so I wouldn't recommend it on a phone.
Now bg2 please... Btw had issues with in-game videos. Their frame-rate was questionable (1fps). Played on Gallaxy Tab 3 (8inch).
I love this port of baldur's gate. Even without the IA you are easily looking at 60+ hours of gameplay. So worth it!
I was shocked and awed how well this port works, I was expecting a disaster. It really is very playable. Roll on Planetscape Torment please

This is the one I've been looking for. None of the others compare to it. Baldur's Gate is simply the best, and playing it on the tablet is just really great, especially late night in bed. If you want the real thing, this is the adventure/RPG to go for.

I'd played baldur's gate before on PC when it came out without the expansion and it was fun but plagued with load times and cd swapping. This is a welcome improvement with pretty good controls and better user interface and updated art in instances where it would not have scaled well with hd screens. I highly recommend giving this game a try as it has a huge amount of content and is one of the best games ever made in my opinion.

I can't tell you how happy I am that this title has arrived for android. I've played it on pc and loved it. I think it's perfect for handheld devices, especially since you can almost save anywhere, and you can zoom in by spreading fingers--awesome touch. Thanks so much for bringing it to us. Worth every penny!

Awesome I loved this game for the pc

The tutorial level took me almost an hour to get through (they could do a much better job of explaining exactly what to click on, instead of using the button names (which we don't see!)). The game is incredibly (for this platform) detailed, and is a nice mix of RTS/TBS, and the ability to give orders while the action is paused is a huge plus (i can't play RTS without that). The controls are a bit small on a 7-inch screen, but they're usable (not always intuitive, though). Plays flawlessly on my pokey Asus TF300, and the 10" screen indeed offers a much nicer play experience for this one. i'm about 10 or 12 hours in, and it's been epic the whole way. Has never crashed nor otherwise bugged out on me. Easily rates right up there with Bard's Tale in terms of overall quality, but has 10x the replayability factory. Supports saving at _almost_ any time, which is a huge plus.
My all time favorite game!

content: Cleared DEVICE space to allow for large install. Began install. Got an error saying there wasn't enough EXTERNAL card space. Got a refund right away. I had over 11GB available on my card... confused. Cleared room off the card and began install again. Downloaded overnight. Took two tries with DL'ing freezing up once. Installed fine. And so far after about six hours of play everything works fairly smooth. On tablet the text is TINY. Wouldn't advise using on a phone. Leave your ham hands off this one.

Under a rubbish port exists a good game waiting to get out.  Galaxy tab 10.1, cutscenes do not work. Jiora's ring quest is bugged, you can't enter the house to begin the quest. Probably other quests as well. Game will crash occasionally when multitasking, such as reading a guide in your browser. You get either a unresponsive black screen, or the app closes. Be sure to save before risking such dangerous behavior. Read forums about multiplayer cross platform compatibility before you buy.  Will change rating if developer releases a fix.
replyContent: Jiora's ring quest has been fixed and the door will no longer impede you from entering the house and completing this quest. We fixed the bug causing the game to crash when minimized to multitask and all versions of the game have been synced across platforms and several multiplayer bugs were fixed. Try again after downloading the latest update!

content: Runs well on my Note 3. Couple of doors have been buggy, but overall could not be happier. One of my favorite games of all time and it's in my pocket.
Constantly freezes...really want to play but can't get through tutorial..

To be honest, I didn't expect a whole lot here. I mean I love Baldur's Gate as much as the next guy, but on a tablet? There's no way that'll be as good as on a PC - or so I thought. Who knew that when I started playing I was in for the most enjoyable Android gaming experience I'd ever had. Everything is just so intuitive that it almost seems like it was created just to play on a tablet. It was pretty smooth even on my Nexus 7 (2012). The only thing I have to say is that a stylus tremendously improved the experience - it just wasn't quite as enjoyable without one. Overall this is definitely something I would recommend to anyone and everyone (that likes this sort of game, of course). Also: very rare and minimal bugs/crashes, nothing game-breaking at all.

samsung note 10.1 2014,  very often (like,  every minute or two)  touch screen will stop responding for roughly 10 seconds.  Sounds still work,  animations still play,  monsters still attack.  Very frustrating,  as it really makes it difficult to get into the game,  having to wait around so often.  Other than that issue,  the game itself is wonderful! I would give 5 stars in a heartbeat if this bug was addressed.

So they have no problem taking my money for this game,but have problems refunding it when it won't even install on my HTC one mini
And I am not just saying that because I worked on the game. I loved playing the game while, and after, making the game. If you enjoy AD&D, this is a game you need to play.

I grew up playing this game and recently bought the enhanced edition for my PC. I fell in love all over again and had to have it for my tablet! This game is playing D&D on your couch by yourself. Tons of different party members to find and choose from, you can be good, evil, kind or greedy! So get started killing anything from kolbolts to ankhegs!

The game and the game engine are both pieces of game history, and despite a few little quirks the port is accurate and playable. I have noticed some minor content changes in the enhanced edition, not enough to make the game completely fresh, but enough that I don't know what's around every corner. I can't imagine playing it on a smaller screen than 7", a pair of reading glasses will help your eyeballs, or you could use the issue to justify buying a larger tablet, I mean, you kinda have to, right?, where's my credit card?

The game play seems ok so far, but the tutorial is troubled with ambiguous instructions and several bugs that are fairly discouraging to a new player like me.  Everything becomes quite clear and the bugs can be (mostly) avoided if you have already read through the "how to play" sections of the manual if you can find it on-line. Bugs include failure to trigger tutorial progress if resting is selected when the spell book is visible,  missing description of the spell button you are told to use, and a few other less critical issues like a phantom text box briefly appearing every time new dialogue is initiated.  Dialogue and all options also stalled at the "final test" stage of the tutorial with no option to progress, forcing the tutorial to be abandoned.  Game play was on a 2012 Galaxy Note 10.1.  The Stylus works well - tool-tips and cursor on "stylus hover", however, was not implemented in this build.
Its great love it fun times but for some reason all cut scene s are half cut off im using a samsung Tab 3 idk whats wromg but the when I start playing its fine just cutscenes

How do you play as a mage? I am in the tutorial and the guy keeps saying ' you haven't taught me the spell yet.' Just how do you teach him? Anyone?
replyContent: Long-tap on Xan's portrait to open his inventory, and then long-tap on the scroll to open its description screen. From there you'll see a button labeled "Write Magic", which will add the spell to Xan's spellbook.

Also, the inability to turn formations when walking. It's always based on the direction from the party leader, but often, this can put your rear characters facing the enemies.  Keep up the good work, Beamdog!

replyContent: We have fixed the bug causing the game to crash when minimized. You may pause the game and issue orders to your characters before resuming the game, and pinch zoom in on them to make it easier to select them and their targets. This should make your battles easier to control and a bit less chaotic.

I understand the dedication to keeping the look and feel of it for the fans but I do think it's on the limit of usability for phone screens.

This can make looting a bit more difficult bc you are trying to loot next to one of your characters and it selects the character instead. I can select my character on the HUD on right side so really no need for this feature. Just a minor annoyance so far in my game expericence but you guys did a perfect job really of bringing back a classic. I am going to buy all your IAPs when I get around to it for keeping them at a minimum and giving us the complete core experience without needing them. They seem to actually be some IAPs that will enrich the experience. I cannot express my grattitude enough that you guys gave us the complete game and expansions for one price no IAPs needed. So when I get around to it I will purchase all the voice, picture packs, and characters to enrich my experience to thank you for keeping IAP nonsense at a minimum. I eagerly await BGIIEE. Please release BGIIEE soon for adventure.
