content: Too bad, but I remember almost any event in this game.

Fantastic port of this 90's classic rpg. I loved the original game and seeing a polished modern interpretation on smart devices is a relief. I'm very pleased to see the developers finish the android version finally have been keeping an eye on this project for quite some time now. Well done guys, look forward to a possible port of baldur's gate 2 shadows of amn or torment!

I played the original Baldurs Gate on the PC back in the 90's and loved it so it was with great anticipation that I waited for the Android port.  I was not disappointed!  The gameplay is flawless, the controls feel natural and the graphics look better than I was expecting. And that's without even talking about the game itself. Baldurs gate is an epic rpg based on the Dungeons & Dragons ruleset. Having said that I had very little familiarity with D&D when I started playing and it's all pretty straightforward once you get going. It's got a great story, interesting characters and tons of scope for different playing styles leading to lots of replayability!  I play this mainly on my 2012 Nexus 7 and performance wise it's seamless, the only slight niggle is that hitting the exact area on the screen to open chests or travel through doors can be a bit fiddly, but only when zoomed right out (it gets a bit blocky when zoomed in).  There's easily 60hrs playtime so in terms of value for money you can't beat it. It's a great achievement to take such a big (and old!) game and port it to tablets and phones. I'm already looking forward to BGII:EE...
Game runs excellent on my rooted HP Touchpad. It is a near perfect port (hell, some menus and stuff still have keyboard shortcuts listed).  A good way to kill an hour or two before bed.  Save often!
Have this game on PC, now Android too! Can't wait for Baldur's Gate II.
This is awesome.  I haven't played this game in years. This game seems like it was made to play on the note 3. Can't say enough oh ya save regularly or you will regret it.
Was all black. Now its been fixed and runs great. No complaints so far. Galaxy S3

replyContent: If you speak to the Tutors (the green-robed monks) around Candlekeep at the start of the game, they have helpful information for new players. There's also a combat training room in the southern part of that first area where you can try out party tactics.

Best Android game to date. Been looking forward to this for a while now and it doesn't disapoint, hours and hours of fun ahead for me. I have not encountered any of the  bugs others have mentioned, it plays fine on my Galaxy Note 2.

Excellent revitalization of an amazing game! I may never play it on PC again!

Great to have a real, full-length RPG for android. I have encountered a few minor bugs that others have commented on. They are infrequent and require occasional restart of the game. Hopefully the devs will update, but already very playable, slow-paced, story-rich classic RPG. Well worth $10.
Game plays great on my Nexus 5. Played up to the first mines so far with no crashes. UPDATE: ran into some lag during Neera's side quest; had to just restart the app.
Great game. Just like the old computer game. Plays without and problems.
Just tried it tonight. It's no good it crashes, was looking for a trial to test it first now I've wasted my money :(
Works very well on Nexus 10.

Half of it doesn't work on a Samsung Note 10.1 2014 edition and heaven help you if you hit the wrong key since you have to hard reboot the device to get back to the home page.  Sack the QA team (it's probably only a cat anyway so no serious harm done)
The screen is black. Fix it or give me my money back
I cant believe I'm playing Baldurs gate on my phone. LG G 2 plays it with no problems.
Amazing perfect on the note 2 worth the wait

Working quite well on my Nexus 5.  Not sure what these other people are complaining about but odds are that their issues are user related or they're just trying to use it on old devices that's probably shouldn't be supported anymore anyway. I just completed the Nashkel Mines and everything is great.  Only encountered one bug in-game and its already been reported.   awesome work and looking forward to the next update.  Worth every penny (and the add-ons too!)
One of the best RPG games finally ported to Android.
An instant buy. One of my favourite RPG's of all time. Playing on 2012 Nexus 7. Controls take some getting used to. Has the occasional stutter but still pleased with the purchase.
Flawlessly delivered and works great on my TF300.  No bugs that I've noticed.  And the game plays much faster with touch interface than with a mouse.

Played for over 6 hours and ran into several bugs. Sometimes the screen wouldn't let me press anything or others the background would turn black. Eventually all the menu buttons on the left of the screen disappeared and never came back even after quitting and reloading. On top of all this the game just wasn't very fun IMO. I played until chapter 2 and couldn't keep going. Wasted $10.

For those who know BG already, it's the same! For those who don't: Possibly the best RPG ever created in portable format.  On the issues mentioned I haven't had any with Note 2. Text is smallish but nowhere near enough to take enjoyment from the game; it's still very readable.

Night scenery hard to see even with the brightness turned all the way up. No option to increase font size. Controls not enhanced, just adapted the original to touch screens. Was hoping for that little bit more, but all  in all a good port.
When baldurs gate 2 coming out?
Does not work on samsung s3. Black backgrounds make it impossible to play. Waste of my 10$
Very buggy on my Galaxy Note 3. Everytime my screen goes off, the game just decided to not respond anymore. If I answer a call, it will just black out. I want a refund.

Awesome to finally see this classic on phone and tablets.  The game works well on my Galaxy S4, but the text is pretty small (as you'd expect on a 5 inch screen). The game also mostly works on my old Asus tf101 which is nice for such an older device: in-game videos do not work as they should and are very choppy.  Some issues prevent me from giving a great score: - The aforementioned problem with in-game videos (but I can live with this) - Sometimes I had a few glitches in the UI (saving and restarting always fixes this though, and it's rare) - This is my biggest gripe, and it's actually a simple fix: there is no support for the in-game console. I know it's cheap to start cheating, but Baldur's Gate is a *big* game and it is *hard*. It would do wonders for replayability and just trying stuff out if it would be possible to use this.

I started my adventure in March on my PC and moved the saved file over to the Android.  It works like a charm on my Samsung 10.1 2014 edition.  The game runs very smoothly, with  a very intuitive and responsive interface.  I look forward to many hours of blissful commuting!
Amazing.

Works a treat on my Galaxy Note 2. Text is a little difficult to read on a 5.5" screen but still very playable.  Would like the ability to move units in a formation at a specified angle like in the origional.
Resolution is off for galaxy s5. Top portion of the screen is not viewable.
Everything is awesome except small lags in cinematics.
Reinstalled 3 times still just a black screen...

Full of game-breaking bugs. Tried the tutorial and ran into multiple issues, ultimately leading to Belt cutting the tutorial short, telling me it's time for my final training... Only to just stand there. After restarting the game I now, like other users, get the black screen of death, stating "the game has stopped working." Yay! $10 flushed. Happy it works on some devices but sheesh, a one year delay still wasn't enough? This reeks of money grab! If only because they implemented IAPs. Consider yourself warned.
This was promised a long time ago. I'm glad you guys finally delivered. Solid port mostly but there are a few bugs here and there.
Works great, glad to see part of my child hood again, don't remember it being this hard though.

Even though I owned this on my iPad, I've never ended up playing it. The game playsq really well on my note 3 however when I exit out of the game and go back, the screen size goes in half and everything looks squeezed and I have to force quit . If I don't save before I quit the game, I would lose progress. If they address this issue, it would be perfect!!!
I bought this app thinking in play with my friends, but I can't see the game! In TCP/IP protocol, i can't type the ip host!  I hope a new version!
replyContent: Several multiplayer issues have been addressed in our latest update, resulting in a much smoother experience. All platform versions have been synced to ensure maximum cross-platform compatibility. Try again after downloading the latest update!

content: Finally it arrived to Android. Hopefully we wont have to wait another year and a half for Baldurs 2.

Just started playing this and already hoping BG II: EE is on it's way soon for android! I know it's already out on iOS and PC. Plays great on my Tegra Note 7. Wouldn't suggest playing on a phone, as the text and interface would be too small
Paid the 10 bucks for the game and I click on the app and I'm getting nothing but a black screen. Will change the rating to 5 stars if I can be accommodated with a solution. Thanks guys!
Galaxy S3 VZW  Background is solid black and interface is invisible. Would love to leave better review but game is unplayable.
Took ages to download. Then crashes before even opens. Maybe the developer should stick to the smaller OS he is used to.
Unplayable
One of the best CRPG finally on Android. Thank you!

The original game was great on PC and the way that it has been ported to tablets is perfect and almost as if the game was originally designed with tablets in mind. I was really concerned with how the UI would work but they have done a great job with making it so simple and work very well. Bring on BG 2 EE and IWD EEs please beamdog?!

The wait was worth it! Having this on a tablet lets me play in any chunk of free time I can find. Microwaving bacon? Play some BG:EE! Waiting for the dog to potty? Play BG:EE! Loading screen in ESO? BG:EE! I gladly deleted several games off my tablet to make room for this, and look forward to BG2:EE.
I've been waiting for this for years and it's finally here! It works great on my Nexus 10...
An excellent game, and this Android port runs perfectly on my Nexus 7. Kudos for bringing a true classic back to life! I would definitely buy the successor too...
Greatest of the great. No one, neither I am qualified to make any comment on this epic masterpiece. Take your sword and shield, maybe your magic power and join us in this legendary adventure.
Very smoth and enjoyable experience. Works great. Highly recommend!
Loved this game on my ipad but it keeps telling me insufficient space although I have over 10 GB of space left oj my phone
Graphics is laughably bad though.   UI and fonts need to scale to 1080p screens properly, rather then being tiny.
Screen is all black and I can only see characters walking around. Have to force stop the game to make it stop running on my s3. Kinda wish I didn't pay for it now.

Let's get the elephant in the room out of the way; some people are justifiably annoyed that the iOS version was released almost 2 years ago. If you can overlook the development delays, Beamdog did produce a port that runs well on recent Android hardware. The game's touch controls on smaller phones can be hit or miss, but that's what larger tablets and styluses are for. Giving the game 5 stars for effort and as motivation to release BG:EE2. BTW, old save games and custom portraits from the PC version work.

If you're wondering about the contrasting reviews, it boils down to your device. I can say that on the nexus 7, the game runs fantastic, but unfortunately this was rushed through it's beta, so many or the devices that were having problems then will still be having them with the release. It was also said that this is intended for tablets, not phones... something that should be put in the app description.   Having said that, if you have one of the devices that it currently works on, it's definitely worth getting. The interface for BG works as if it was created for a touch screen, and the EE version's ability to zoom in and out makes it an even greater experience. Can't wait for BG2.
Every time I try to launch the game it freezes and fails to respond. I have a nexus 10 running android 4.4.2 please fix! Edit - reinstalled and its now working. Edit 2. Stopped working again.

Beamdog worked hard to bring this release to Android and for that, I, and many other fans of this beloved classic isometric RPG are grateful.  If you've never heard of Baldur's Gate, know that it influenced many other games and is widely considered the godfather of true fantasy RPGs. The D&D ruleset may seem overwhelming at first but give it a go and know that the journey becomes easier after a couple hours of playtime. Having said that, Baldur's Gate is intentionally a difficult, rewarding experience.
All good except fonts are too small. Mine is Galaxy note  3, let alone other phones.  Pads may be better.  So if you  can make fonts configurable I will give  5 stars.

You won't find another RPG with this amount of depth for your Android device. Love that it uses AD&D 2nd edition rules - I spent several years in the early 90's playing this version of tabletop D&D. The charm and strength of Baldur's Gate is its resemblance to tabletop D&D. It truly feels like you can 'roleplay' your character through the multitude of conversation choices in the game. The writing and artwork really brings the Forgotten Realms setting alive and immerses you deeply in a novel like story without feeling linear. I can't  wait for BG2! Also, this game plays perfectly on the Nook HD+ and is optimal for a larger screen IMO while playing with a stylus. Easy 5 stars here.
Has there been any word on the rendered background black screen issue? I've not been able to find any support on the issue.   Devs, please help us out.  The game is unplayable.

Awesome god I remember buying this game from circuit city way back on 6 CDs and a massive Instruction book tell u I'm a happy camper with this port and darkstone port im in nostalgic heaven pretty old school brutall game so maybe mostly for old schoolers not much hand holding just spend the 10 bucks Tons of content like easy 100 hours if u hardcore
Will rate higher if this gets fixed
Finally
SGIII - Works like a dream. Very happy with the quality of the port and of course the game itself is timeless.

BG:EE is such a great nostalgic game and works well with touchscreen interface. I would give 5/5 but there are steps back from the PC enhanced edition, notably with party movement (no rotating nor waypoints) as well as previously included expansions (2 npcs and extra portraits/voices) being sold seperately.
Best of android RPGs!  Works great on my Note 3(SM-N900T) so far. Love it when I played it on my Pc a long time ago and love it now on my phone.
Bought and downloaded off Google store and simply says 'Unfortunately Baldur's Gate has stopped working'. Doesn't even start so completely unplayable, really disappointing.
Runs perfectly and you can just tell this games perfect on tablet great blast from past
Budddyyyyyyyyy
All sound, graphics, animations.  Downloaded all extra content.  Goodbye free time lol.  Galaxy s4. Thank you devs.
Not loading on my nexus 5. Force closes every time. I see the updater load for a split second then FC.
Not working on S3
Will not even open.  Tried uninstall and reinstall with same result.  Emailed google for refund.
Still some bugs, but they'll be ironed out fairly quickly.
Finally!
Nexus 7. Works fine. Had a weird problem where it would hang but I restarted my tablet and that fixed it. Few hours in and overall really fun RPG.
Alll gooooood otherwise
Works perfectly so far.
been waiting for this, works just fine.

I loved playing this game on the PC when it came out in the '90s. This has now got to be one of the best Android RPGs. One reviewer gave it a single star because of the in-app purchases (you can buy additional characters) the key word is 'additional' they were not in the original game so they are completely non-essential. A poor reason for 1 star when the rest of the game is so exceptional. Superb game, highly recommended.

The frame rate is a bit low on my N 10, however the interface is snappy as can be so the game is completely playable..  Beamdog did an incredible job with this and while I can't wait for BGII to be finished for Android I need time to finish this one a few times.  :D
Works perfectly on the HTC One M8
Has worked surprisingly well with a touch interface.  Great Job!
A classic game

I remember getting the game back in 1998 and it came on 6 cds. Now it is on my phone! Seems to work really well, a bit disappointed that they sell the new characters. Especially since I bought the PC version as well. Selling an app for $10 and then asking for more money so you can get voices and characters is a bit too much.  But the old game is still all there and it is awesome!
Never played the original, but now I can!! Runs great on my s5.  Only issue is my graphics setting is greyed out, so for that 4 stars.
Awesome game. Thanks beamdog!
Works brilliantly on my Note 10.1 and on my Note 3. Baldurs Gate on the go, happy days!
Works great, plays great, only gripe is that the buttons on the sides seem a little small but even that isn't a big deal. Good job!
Brings back some good  memories.  Awesome game.
Nexus 10. Black screen. "Unfortunately baldurs gate is badly coded and has crashed"
Excellent recreation of the classic. A little slow but otherwise working fine. Highly recommended.
Runs pretty well on my Nexus 7. It does lock up every so often. Also, in the options the "graphics" option is grayed out. Any idea why?
Such an amazing game, exactly like pc version, I'm so glad that they released this for android!

For one I want to point out to all of the people expecting it to be amazing on their phone... aint happening. Unless you have a note. Other than that, I have it on my tablet and its AMAZING been playing baldurs gate off and on for 12 years now and I can finally take it with me :D
Finally here.

Love love love this game. I used to play this game when I was younger and it really jumped me into the whole role playing game genre. If you like role playing games this is definitely one you'll want to try. The port from PC is actually quite amazing. Everything being touch screen now
I loved the original, but this remake is almost unplayable. So many different bugs kill what would otherwise be a good game. Do NOT buy.
Great to see an old PC favorite ported to Android

I played and loved this back when it was a multi-CD set, and now with the polish and hard work, it's even better. Didn't get the DLC yet, but I have it on the PC and know it is worth the small fee for great adventures.  Keep up the good work. Hope to see the Sequel come on the play store soon. Maybe even IWD:EE
Excellent game, plays flawlessly on TF700
This is a classic, I played it on PC when it first came out. All of the content is there. Game works perfectly on my Transformer Prime TF201.
True to the original. Awesome
If my device is locked or goes to sleep (stock 2013 Nexus 7 and CM11 Note 2) or if you switch away, the app just goes to a black screen.
I have this on PC, but wanted it on my tablet. So glad it's finally here so that I can play. on the go!

An exceptional port of an exceptional game. Interface is very well translated over to touchscreen, it does seem to be more directed to a tablet; my Nexus 7 handles it competently. My only issue are the in-app purchases: £1.05 for a portrait pack?! Silly, especially with the content being offered for free by the online community.
Black screen, only can see monsters and characters. Installed directly from app store. Need a refund.
The screen on the X is a bit small.  Stylus input is best.  Touch controls seem like they are getting easier to use.
Playing very well so far. Can't wait for more classic RPG titles. Baldurs gate is one of the greatest games from a golden age.
I mean I grew up on on it, don't throw hipster croutons at me.
Great game - as good as I remember and then some. With the advantage of being playable on the sofa :)
Although not a huge fan of having to pay for the new Npc's as it just makes it more money... But still! Amazing game I can now play anywhere! Thanks Beamdog, can't wait until Bg2
App does not work on my phone. I installed it directly from the google play store. When I try to play, there is only a black screen. Was really looking forward to playing.
Finally
As good as I remember if not better!

Baldur's Gate Enhanced Edition is hands down the best edition of the game, and now after a ton of hard work from a dedicated crew, we get to play in on Android. This game easily gets 5 stars, it's hard to match the experience of this extensive game being on a tablet (and some smartphones), and with the team still ready to squash any and all bugs, this is easily worth every dollar.

I've been a massive Baldur's Gate fan since it was released, and I'm so glad someone picked up the mantle and updated the engine for modern systems.  Even though this was designed for tablet use, it still works perfectly fine on my Galaxy Nexus.  So far, no complaints about the execution of the engine.  I only discounted one star due to the new characters being missing.  I believe €9 is particularly high for a mobile game, and leaving the new NPCs out as additional revenue DLC undermines that value.  Other than for that I would have given 5 stars hands down.
Loved playing this back in the day. Minsc is Back!

I can't believe you sell characters with real money in this game. What a BS greedy strategy. You can say that "you don't have to buy them" but the mere fact that you offer them ruins the whole experience. Greedy idiots. I want a refund.
I'm very pleased to say that this is what mobile gaming needs to get into. The 10 dollar price tag is definitely worth it.
it works finally but I am only giving it 3 stars because it still has no console commands
If you are RPG fan you must buy it!

I'm having so much fun playing BG after so many years. The game seems to be built for tablets, so easy to play. There are a few small niggles eg trying to get through the odd door can take a few clicks but it's not really an issue. My wife isn't happy with the time I've logged already as a member of the beta team. In a nut shell buy it, play it, and relive one of the best RPG's ever today.
Been waiting for this for some time now. Super happy to be able to play one of the best games ever on my android tablet. Well done devs.
Worth waiting for
One of the best RPGs I have ever played!  I love that I can now play this on my tablet!

Probably one of the single best written RPG's ever made.  Some of the AD&D 2nd edition rules may seem a little dated, but the pre-rendered graphics are still pretty good looking for a game that is 15 years old.  Make no mistake, this is a HARD game.  It is NOT a casual game. Save often and be prepared to die.  A lot. Also, don't try to do EVERYTHING. Play the character you create and enjoy the story.
